Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: கைவேல் களிற்றொடு போக்கி வருபவன் மெய்வேல் பறியா நகும்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The hero who after casting the lance in his hand on an elephant, comes (in search of another) will pluck the one (that sticks) in his body and laugh (exultingly).

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A heroic warrior stands on a battlefield. He has just thrown his only spear ('கைவேல்') at an elephant ('களிற்றொடு போக்கி'). He is now unarmed.
Layered_Composition.Midground: He turns to look for another weapon. He sees a spear sticking out of his own chest, from a wound he has already sustained ('மெய்வேல்').
Layered_Composition.Background: Instead of crying out in pain, a fierce, exultant, and joyful laugh erupts from him ('நകും'). He is shown in the act of pulling the spear from his own body to use as his next weapon.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A true hero, having used his weapon, will joyfully pluck an enemy's spear from his own body to continue the fight.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The act of laughing while pulling a spear from his own wound is the ultimate expression of heroic spirit and fearlessness.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Exultant, fearless, indomitable, joyful in battle.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: Dramatic, chaotic battlefield light. A heroic spotlight shines on the warrior. The blood from his wound and his joyful, fierce expression are the focal points.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A dynamic close-up on the warrior's torso and face at the moment he pulls the spear and laughs.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with a gritty, realistic depiction of the wound and the emotion.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: Hyper-realistic fantasy art, heroic bloodshed genre.
